duties_responsibilities.duty: Responsible for the collection of blood and other specimens from all patient populations using prescribed procedures with accuracy, skill, professionalism, and superb customer service.
Perform accurate patient registration, including knowledge of insurance codes and billing procedures.
Maintain a clean and orderly work environment and ensure an adequate supply of materials.
Follow proper policy and procedure for specimen transport and specimen processing, including documentation of draws and processing.
Examine all specimens submitted for proper labeling and necessary information prior to final acceptance.
Provide patients and other customers with necessary collection instructions, per department standards.
Assist in training by demonstrating techniques or methods to students/new staff, when requested.
Maintain a professional, mature, positive attitude while on the job and observe proper safety practices.
Verify patient identification according to SOP, ensuring correct identification of patients/specimen with orders.
Demonstrate and integrate age-specific care with consideration to physical communication, safety, nutrition, and psychosocial needs for various age groups.
Be proficient with computer programs and navigate through information systems.
Perform other clerical and technical duties as instructed or requested.
Obtain blood specimens from infants to adults as skillfully as possible using proper technique under specified aseptic conditions.
Handle children, difficult patients, and unconscious patients with proper care post-invasive phlebotomy procedure.
Organize, prioritize, transport, and distribute incoming laboratory workload while also notifying appropriate departments per established protocols.

education_certification.credential: Completion of phlebotomy training program or equivalent experience is preferred.
High school graduate or equivalent required.
